title: How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel

metadata.description: Learn about How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Introduction
content_sections.content: How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn how to convert time to Seconds using Excel.
Time can be converted into seconds using Excel.
The number
86400
can be used to convert time to seconds.
86400 Explained
Excel uses a 24-hour system.
Each
day
has
24 hours
.
One
hour
is
60 minutes
.
One
minute
is
60 seconds
.
24
(hours) *
60
(minutes) *
60
(seconds) =
86400
Example
00:01 * 86400 = 60
The example returns
60
because one minute (
00:01
) is 60 seconds.
Explanation
Each day has 24 hours.
Each hour can be understood as a percentage of the total hours of the day.
01:00 = 1/24
02:00 = 2/24
03:00 = 3/24
and so on.
The percentage can be used to find the seconds.
Example (15:00)
15:00 * 86400 = 54000
Fifteen hours equals
54000
seconds.
15:00
is 15/24 (
0.625
).
0.625 * 86400 = 54000
Multiply to get 86400
24 (hours) * 60 (minutes) * 60 (seconds) = 86400

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is One
hour?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of One
hour is '60 minutes'.

quiz.question:
What is One
minute?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of One
minute is '60 seconds'.

summary: This tutorial covers How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of How to Convert Time to Seconds using Excel and how to apply it in your projects.
